gui.guielement



class GUIElement;
Base class for all GUI elements. Can be used directly to draw empty elements.

void die();
Destroy this element.

final Vector2i position_global();
Get position in screen space.

final Vector2i position_local();
Get position relative to parent element.

final Vector2u size();
Return size of this element in screen space.

final Rectanglei bounds_global();
Return bounding rectangle of this GUI element in screen space.

final void add_child(GUIElement child);
Add a child element.

final void remove_child(GUIElement child);
Remove a child element.

final bool visible();
Return true if this element is visible, false if hidden.

final void hide();
Hide this element and its children.

final void show();
Make this element and its children visible;

final GUIElement parent();
Return parent of this element.

final bool is_child(GUIElement element);
Determine if an element is a child of this element.

this(GUIElementParams params);
Construct a GUIElement with specified parameters.

Params:
GUIElementParams params Parameters for construction of GUIElement.

class GUIRoot;
GUI root container. Contains drawing and input handling methods.

this(Platform platform);
Construct the GUI root with size equal to screen size.

void draw(VideoDriver driver);
Draw the GUI.

GUIElement root();
Get the actual root element of the GUI.

void update();
Update the GUI.

void add_child(GUIElement child);
Add a child element.

void remove_child(GUIElement child);
Remove a child element.

void die();
Destroy this GUIRoot.

void realign(VideoDriver driver);
Realign the GUI.

class GUIElementFactory: gui.guielement.GUIElementFactoryBase!(GUIElement).GUIElementFactoryBase;
Factory used for GUI element construction.

See Also:
GUIElementFactoryBase

class GUIElementFactoryBase(T);
Template base class for all GUI element factories, template input specifies type of GUI element constructed by the factory.

Position and size of GUI elements are specified with strings containing simple math expressions which are evaluated to determine the actual coordinates.

Supported operators are + +,-,*,/ as well as parentheses.

Furthermore, there are builtin macros representing window and parent coordinates. These are:

w_right : Window right end (left end is always 0, so this is window width) w_bottom : Window bottom end (top end is always 0, so this is window height) p_left : Parent left end p_right : Parent right end p_top : Parent top end p_bottom : Parent bottom end

Params:
x X position math expression.

Default:
"p_left" y = Y position math expression.

Default:
"p_top" width = Width math expression.

Default:
"64" height = Height math expression.

Default:
"64" draw_border = Draw border of the element?

Default:
true

GUIElementParams gui_element_params();
Return a struct containing factory parameters packaged for GUIElement ctor

T produce();
Return a new instance of the class produced by the factory with parameters of the factory.

struct GUIElementParams;
GUI element constructor parameters
